addressleaf.section:
To o
r
very Loving frend Thomas Bodley Esq
r
. one of the Assistant
for her Ma
ty
in the
Councell of State
in the
United Provinc
of the
Lowe Countryes
.

Letter fr
o
e Counsell touching repare of Ostend. 12 N
o
89

page.lettertext:
fol.180r
Belgia 1589 12 Novem
b
to M
r
Bodly
After o
r
hartye Comendac
o
ns: Whereas yo
u
have here bene heretofore by
direction from
her Ma
tie
and from us required to solicite the
States
G
nall
of those united Provinces, concerning the re
ac
o
n of the Sea
breaches at
ostend
, who (as by yo
r
l
re
s appeareth) have not in more
then three monethes sithence the deliverie of her Ma
t
pleasure therein
vouchesafed any answer, whereat her Ma
tie
and we doe not a lyttle
m
vayle considering of what importance yt it unto them to have that
Towne p
r
served and kept from the handes of the enemye. Her Ma
tie
nevertheless regarding ther safeties more than they doe themselves, and
foreseing that the matter will admitt no furder delaye, but that eith
r
the Towne must be forthw
th
abandoned, or some
n
te defence made
against the sea for the preservac
o
n of her subject
there in garrison, if
they shall continue the guarde of the same hathe taken order that
one Companie of her auxiliarie forces shalbe
n
tly Cassed, and the
ordenarye paye of the said Companie for one whole yere converted
to the repayring of the said
breaches
, as by an order in that behalf
sett downe by her Ma
t
expresse Comaundement shall appeare unto
yo
u
a Copie whereof yo
u
shall receave heerinclosed,
togeth
r
wherew
th
yo
u
shall acquainte the said States g
nall
, to the ende they may
take no exception to the cassing of the said band as in reason the
y
ought not considering the money wherew
th
the same is to be mainteynd
shalbe employed in the repayring and p
r
serving of one of ther owne
Townes of as great importance as anie w
th
in the Provinces United,
and is but for the forbearaunce of one Companie of ther ordi
n
y
strengthe for the tyme: and shall signifye unto them that her
Ma
tie
dothe looke they shall allowe thereof, and therefore yo
u
shall
expressely require them in her Ma
t
name to cause a publicke acte
M
r
Bodley
fol.180v
to be made, notifying thereby their allowance of her Ma
t
course
and order therein taken, w
ch
if they shall refuse, her Ma
tie
shall
have good cause to holde them careles of themselves and ingratefull
towardes her w
ch
yo
u
shall advise them to avoyde if they desire the
Contynuaunce of her goodnes towardes them.
And so byd yo
u
hartely farewell. From the Court at Richemond the xij
th
of
November
1589
Yo
r
very loving frend
Christopher Hatton: C
ant
William Burghley
Charles Howard
Hunsdon
Cobham
Francis Knollys
James Croft
Thomas Heneage
John Perrot
John Wolley
John Fortescue
